channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Is Japan bracing for another megaquake?
From 'AI slop' to 'parasocial', how 2025’s words of the year reflect humanity's digital disillusionment
Explained: How the Thailand-Cambodia conflict goes beyond border fighting
IndiGo’s flight schedules cut by 5%: What does it mean for passengers?
Why has YouTube’s Neal Mohan been named TIME’s CEO of the year?
Far-right commentator Nick Fuentes refers to Usha Vance as ‘jeet’. What does this racist slur mean?
From protests to polls: Nepal’s March 5 vote tests a new political era
item.description: With so many parties running, the election could also end without a clear winner, creating more uncertainty

item.title: How Jaishankar’s Pakistan diagnosis is accurate, and why India must build on it
item.description: The External Affairs Minister is correct in categorically stating that India should never seek to hyphenate itself with Pakistan–now India is far ahead of Pakistan

item.title: Sheikh Hasina’s trial was imperfect, but it was not a farce
item.description: Former Bangladesh minister Mohammad Ali Arafat’s attempt to paint Hasina’s trial as a farce crumbles on its own contradictions

item.title: Geopolitical signaling, strategic autonomy and a decisive shift in power equation: India’s diplomacy sparkles during Putin visit
item.description: It may not be a coincidence that neither did Zelenskyy had anything to say about Putin’s schmoozing with Modi, nor did Trump fire off another grumpy Truth Social post — a triumph of Indian diplomacy

item.title: The way the Ukraine war ends will decide how the multipolar world unfolds
item.description: How the Ukraine war pans out, when and how it ends and who the hidden beneficiaries are, as much in strategic terms as in economic terms, will decide the way the idea of a multipolar world will progress

item.title: What Putin’s Delhi visit and India-Russia 2.0 mean for China
item.description: The Delhi summit positions India and Russia in testing the logic of resilience and prompts China to recalibrate accordingly
